info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:25PM CDT until March 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WILL COUNTY... At 423 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Elwood, or near Wilmington, moving northeast at 55 mph. A second severe thunderstorm was located near Verona in Grundy county, which may also move into the warned area west of Wilmington. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Manhattan around 430 PM CDT. New Lenox around 435 PM CDT. Mokena around 440 PM CDT. Frankfort around 445 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Preston Heights, Symerton, Wilton Center and Godley. This includes... Channahon State Park and Chicagoland Speedway... Route 66 Raceway. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 235 and 248. I-57 between mile markers 328 and 329. I-80 between mile markers 133 and 143. I-355 near mile marker 1. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
